wikipedia_page.main: John Cowburn Beavan, Baron Ardwick (29 April 1910 – 18 August 1994) was a British journalist.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: **John Beavan, Baron Ardwick, life peer. Son of Emily. His granddaughter Carrie Symonds is Boris' partner.

In 1937, Harrisson, with Humphrey Jennings and Charles Madge, founded Mass-Observation, a project to study the everyday lives of ordinary people in Britain. An early project, Worktown, was based in Bolton. His cousin, BBC World Service broadcaster Anne Symonds (mother of the journalist Matthew Symonds by John Beavan, Baron Ardwick), worked with him at Mass-Observation for a time.

Caroline Louise Bevan Symonds was born on 17 March 1988 to Matthew Symonds, co-founder of The Independent, and Josephine Mcaffee (née Lawrence), a lawyer working for that newspaper.Bird, Steve; Sheridan, Danielle; Horton, Helena (3 May 2020). "Baby Johnson named in tribute to doctors". The Sunday Telegraph. Her paternal grandfather was John Beavan, Baron Ardwick (at one time editor of the Daily Herald and later, during the 1970s, a Labour Party MEP), and her paternal grandmother was Anne Symonds, a BBC World Service journalist.

In 1948, Symonds was divorced from her husband and applied for a job with the BBC Overseas Service, commissioning talks and making arts and other programmes. She worked on Under Big Ben and the Meet an MP spot for London Calling Europe. She was close to Hugh Gaitskell and Denis Healey. In 1953, she gave birth to Matthew Symonds, son of John Beavan, Baron Ardwick and co-founder of The Independent. He is the father of Carrie Johnson, the wife of Prime Minister Boris Johnson.
